info.game_comments: (Cheryl: I'm Cheryl of the Clue Crew.  See what we serve up today on Jeopardy!)

(1, 1).clue: 1 of the 3 Indian cities where the British founded universities in 1857

(2, 1).clue: The advice DQYDJ means don't quit your this

(3, 1).clue: In 2001 she made history: her album "J. Lo" & her movie "The Wedding Planner" were both No. 1 in the same week

(4, 1).clue: Its state dog is the Boston Terrier

(5, 1).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew reports from the tennis court.)  Once meaning "to hinder", it's the call on a serve when the ball hits the net & drops over

(6, 1).clue: Unit of sand, or of sense(5)

(1, 2).clue: In the 200s B.C., after the bloody Kalinga campaign, King Ashoka embraced this religion & nonviolence

(2, 2).clue: This animated TV mom is symbolized here:@@@@ :-)

(3, 2).clue: She got an Oscar nomination for her role as a gun moll in "Bullets over Broadway"

(4, 2).clue: 2/3 of this state's population lives in New Castle, one of its 3 counties

(5, 2).clue: In tennis it's an exchange of strokes; in auto racing it's a long-distance competition

(1, 3).clue: After a 1998 nuclear test, this country's prime minister said, "We have evened the score with India"

(2, 3).clue: Nixon could have used "IANAC" -- "I am not" this

(3, 3).clue: This sitcom star was the voice of Hogarth's mom in "The Iron Giant"

(4, 3).clue: This state's name comes from the Sioux for "sky-tinted waters", which probably refers to its 10,000 lakes

(5, 3).clue: (Sofia serves up an infraction.) 2-word term for the infraction being committed here

(1, 4).clue: The bodacious Tata family launched this industry in India in 1901, the year the "U.S." corporation was founded

(2, 4).clue: The abbreviation "BBFBBM" means "Body by Fisher, brains by" this toymaker

(3, 4).clue: Joe Cocker sang "Up Where We Belong", the love theme from "An Officer and a Gentleman", with this woman

(4, 4).clue: Nestled between Ohio & Illinois, it's the smallest mainland state in area west of the Appalachians

(5, 4).clue: This American phenom with a 140-MPH serve is known as the "A-Rod of Tennis"

(1, 5).clue: A 1967 law kept English as a national language of education until all states would accept this one

(2, 5).clue: Look sideways at the smiley seen here & you'll have sighted this king:5:-)

(3, 5).clue: She gave notice as Jeanie Bueller, Ferris' cranky sister in a 1986 film

(4, 5).clue: This state was home to the world's first drive-in movie theater & the first boardwalk

(5, 5).clue: (Sofia serves up a shot.) The shot being gracefully executed here is this one with an 8-letter name

(1, 1).clue: After slaying Grendel, the title character of this epic poem becomes king of the Geats & rules for 50 years

(2, 1).clue: It was Gabriel Fahrenheit who substituted this for alcohol in the thermometer

(3, 1).clue: This prefix appears with thyroid, normal & legal

(5, 1).clue: Appointed by President Johnson, he was the first African-American U.S. Supreme Court justice

(6, 1).clue: Slim Pickens was the B-52 captain who saddled up a hydrogen bomb in this 1964 Kubrick classic

(1, 2).clue: The general prologue of this masterpiece is heard here

(2, 2).clue: Oxygen discoverer Joseph Priestley dubbed the material he used as an eraser this

(3, 2).clue: The schwa used in a dictionary's pronounciation key looks like this lower case letter turned upside down

(5, 2).clue: At 34 years, he was the longest-serving U.S. Supreme Court chief justice

(6, 2).clue: We got a laugh when Slim appeared on this comedy variety show hosted from 1969 to 1992 by Roy Clark

(1, 3).clue: The titular hero of this allegory is a simple plowman

(2, 3).clue: Frederick Russell is best known for his study on the life history of this whale food found on the ocean surface

(3, 3).clue: A simple song, or the bag used by military personnel to carry small items

(5, 3).clue: This '70s "Hollywood Squares" host was born Pierre LaCock

(6, 3).clue: Slim made a statement in a bean-eating scene in this 1974 Mel Brooks Western spoof

(1, 4).clue: This Arthurian hero stars in an alliterative Middle English poem in which he battles the Green Knight

(2, 4).clue: To get a suitable celluloid film for his new inventions, Edison called on this man

(3, 4).clue: It's the act of shaving one's head, or the part of a monk's head that has been shaved

(5, 4).clue: Seen here, he gave us plenty of "Happy Days"

(6, 4).clue: Educating as well as entertaining, Slim appeared in the 1973 film "Pat Garrett &" this outlaw

(1, 5).clue: This venerable monk quoted Caedmon's Hymn in his "Ecclesiastical History of the English People"

(2, 5).clue: Like Mobius & his strip, this German mathematician is famous for a one-sided object -- a bottle

(3, 5).clue: A synonym for delectable, it may be an alteration of sumptuous

(5, 5).clue: He was the man with a 1947 "Plan" that helped rebuild Europe

(6, 5).clue: In 1979 Slim played Sgt. Wiley on this TV series with trucker Greg Evigan & a simian sidekick

(0, 0).clue: Among the 854 people the Russian Orthodox Church canonized in 2000 was this czar who was buried in St. Petersburg in 1998
